headline: DeSantis signs $1.2B tax-break package targeting gas, diapers, kids' clothing
author: Ron DeSantis
sentences: "During this sales tax exemption period, tax is not due on the retail sales of impact-resistant doors, impact-resistant garage doors, and impact-resistant windows for commercial or noncommercial use," the Department of Revenue announced.
DeSantis signed into law, nine sales tax holidays or temporary exemptions and a motor fuel tax exemption," Florida's Department of Revenue announced in a calendar for upcoming tax breaks.
A similar window is slotted for the state's motor fuel tax holiday in October and a special "tool time" week in September focused on home improvement purchases.
The governor blamed the inflation on President Biden's administration, boasting that new tax breaks would be the latest step in combating the increased costs.
Ron DeSantis signed a hefty tax relief bill into law, hoping the parade of seasonal reductions will save Floridians' bank accounts from surging prices.
Breaks include a back-to-school sales tax holiday from July 25 to Aug. 7, when school supplies and children's clothing will be marked tax-free.
"I think weve done more than any other state to step up against the Biden-flation headwinds to give relief to our citizens," DeSantis said.
Other tax holidays include: children's books, disaster preparedness, freedom week, diapers and clothing, appliances, and home hardening.
"This is actually the largest tax relief in the history of the state of Florida  $1.2 billion tax relief package," DeSantis added.
The exemptions will be rolled out piecemeal over the coming fiscal year with specific dates allotted for different commodities.
The bill is expected to save state citizens approximately $1.1 billion on purchases, including diapers, clothing, gas and more.
The tax breaks for baby and toddler clothes, diapers, and Energy Star appliances will last a full year.
Home hardening, a tax break on home reinforcement and safety updates, will run a full two years.
DeSantis signed the wide-ranging relief package Thursday in Ocala, Florida.
Fox News' Micah Maidenberg and Alison Sider contributed to this report.
